timeline.message: removed and replaced custom elements and stylings
sorting component assessment values in reverse order (worst first)

timeline.bodyText: This doc is outdated (onItemClick does not appear in function signature) and "choosen" is misspelled
timeline.author: mfbieber

timeline.message: passing find item function to search

timeline.bodyText: I thought the dashboard had been removed. What is this then? Is this the container for the buttons on the bottom of a map?
timeline.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText:
I would rename this to something like e.g. StatusLegend or something that better represents what this actually is (also DashboardLayout. In addition,
I just saw that this is just the Toolbar I was talking about in one of the other comments (I wouldn't allow the map to be visible below it).
replies.author: mfbieber

timeline.bodyText: Is findFunction a function for the search field? I would name it searchFunction
timeline.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText: It actually is "locateFunction" to scroll to the given item in the map. I will rename it.
replies.author: bonndan

timeline.author: mfbieber
mfbieber

timeline.bodyText:
What has to be done with this TODO?
And I noticed that it is really difficult to click on the relation. I am quite sure, that an user would not have a clue that the relations are clickable. I just came across the fact that it is clickable, because I looked up how MapRelation is used in the code.

The lines must be thicker in order to be clickable properly
A hint or something must exist to invite the user to click them, e.g. also change the mouse to the hand symbol when hovering over the (thicker) lines
timeline.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText:
The TODO says that there are objects for items and relations available (loaded via API), but these are not used in here.
Regarding map relations: #348
replies.author: bonndan

replies.bodyText: The hand symbol is working, nice!
replies.author: mfbieber

timeline.bodyText: Instead of using this elements to style the text, consider using Typography from Material UI. I also saw it in the Events.tsx.
timeline.author: mfbieber

timeline.bodyText: Here it is also "chosen" and not "choosen"
timeline.author: mfbieber

timeline.bodyText: I also don't understand this TODO. I just can't parse the sentence :) What needs to be done here?
timeline.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText: I meant it is not necessary to split strings since each item has a fullyQualifiedIdentifier that can be used directly as API call path element. Also, the complete data has already been loaded (but not by the search component)
replies.author: bonndan

replies.bodyText:
So we could just do get(`/assessment/${landscapeIdentifier}`) directly and our backend already supports that?
Or what has to be done to be able to do that call?
Regarding the already loaded data: do you mean that this call is not really necesary because another call to the backend already retrieved the data this call would retrieve?
replies.author: mfbieber

timeline.bodyText: I noticed that in the map, it is not possible to click on the group background to focus on that group. I would have expected to get a focus on it and to have the group information displayed at the "sidebar"
timeline.author: mfbieber

timeline.bodyText: The sidebar is more like a card. I would call it InformationCardor something else than "sidebar". I think sidebar is actually a bar at the right or left side of the page that goes from the top to the bottom?
timeline.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText: As mentioned the sidebar indeed is a container for content, mostly cards, and goes from top to bottom 😄
replies.author: bonndan

timeline.bodyText:
I like the search field 👍
Unfortunately, it does not work well all the time. This should be better (backend functionality):

find results regardless of upper and lowercase input
find also partial words, e.g. with "word" I would like to already get "wordpress". Maybe one could match once an user has typed 3 chars
"emailer" does not find the emailer. This is most probably a bug?
timeline.author: mfbieber

timeline.bodyText: See my comment above about the naming of the "sidebar", that in my opinion is a card showing information and not a sidebar :)
timeline.author: mfbieber

replies.bodyText: My idea was that the sidebar could hold any information, although now mostly single cards appear. However, if you click the "log" button on the front page or the "more/extend" symbol next to the search field, other content that cards appears.
replies.author: bonndan

replies.bodyText: Okay, so the sidebar contains cards. Alright ;)
replies.author: mfbieber

timeline.message: renamed dashboard to status bar, added background color
[#349] bigger strokes, pointer cursor on relation paths
